commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription create
commands.summary: Create the subscriptions that should be monitored by the Elastic monitor resource.
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor monitored-subscription create --configuration-name
                                                 --monitor-name
                                                 --resource-group
                                                 [--monitored-subscription-list]
                                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                 [--operation {Active, AddBegin, AddComplete, DeleteBegin, DeleteComplete}]
examples: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription create --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor --configuration-name default

commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription delete
commands.summary: Delete the subscriptions that are being monitored by the Elastic monitor resource.
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor monitored-subscription delete [--configuration-name]
                                                 [--ids]
                                                 [--monitor-name]
                                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                 [--resource-group]
                                                 [--subscription]
                                                 [--yes]
examples: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription delete --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor --configuration-name default

commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription list
commands.summary: List all the subscriptions currently being monitored by the Elastic monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription list --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor

commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription show
commands.summary: Get all the subscriptions currently being monitored by the Elastic monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription show --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor --configuration-name default

commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription update
commands.summary: Update the subscriptions that should be monitored by the Elastic monitor resource.
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor monitored-subscription update [--add]
                                                 [--configuration-name]
                                                 [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                 [--ids]
                                                 [--monitor-name]
                                                 [--monitored-subscription-list]
                                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                 [--operation {Active, AddBegin, AddComplete, DeleteBegin, DeleteComplete}]
                                                 [--remove]
                                                 [--resource-group]
                                                 [--set]
                                                 [--subscription]

commands.name: az elastic monitor monitored-subscription wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
